thread.title: Plumas Bank Promotes Boigon to Executive Vice President, Chief Information Officer

author: cnbc.com
title: Plumas Bank Promotes Boigon to Executive Vice President, Chief Information Officer
text:
Quincy, Calif., April 10, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Plumas Bank recently announced that Aaron Boigon has been promoted to executive vice president, chief information officer. In his role, Boigon oversees all technology operations and project management at the Bank. He is responsible for the deployment of new up-to-date technologies, enhancement of clients' technology experience, improving operational efficiency, and the provisioning of security and cyber threat protection.
Andrew J. Ryback, Plumas Bank director, president and chief executive officer, commented, “Aaron has led numerous strategic initiatives and projects which have improved our network infrastructure. His guidance and the systems that he has developed across the entire Company have had a direct positive impact on our employees’ and customers’ experience and this promotion recognizes his accomplishments.” Ryback added, “Aaron’s visionary leadership and expertise brings a fresh, new perspective and broad experience to our executive team and I look forward to his continuing contributions to support Plumas Bank’s strategic growth goals.”
Boigon joined Plumas Bank in September 2013. He has over 25 years of technology and business management experience. He graduated with honors and distinction from the University of Washington in 1997, double majoring in philosophy and history. Boigon’s intrinsic interest in computers led him to a career in the technology field. He spent five years of his career in Silicon Valley working in the technology industry and 10 years working for a leading IT services company in Reno, Nevada. Boigon recently expanded his operational knowledge of banking and has completed a three-year degree from the Graduate School of Banking at Colorado.
About Plumas Bank
Founded in 1980, Plumas Bank is a locally owned and managed full-service community bank headquartered in Northeastern California. The Bank operates twelve branches: eleven located in the California counties of Plumas, Lassen, Modoc, Shasta, Placer, Nevada, and one branch in the Nevada County of Washoe. The Bank also operates three loan production offices: two located in the California Counties of Placer and Butte, and one located in the Oregon County of Klamath. Plumas Bank offers a wide range of financial and investment services to consumers and businesses and has received nationwide Preferred Lender status with the United States Small Business Administration. For more information, please visit our website at www.plumasbank.com .
